titlestmt.titleproper: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia publications 1818-2002
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia publications

bioghist.p: The Academy's scientific publications represent America's longest-running serial publishing program devoted to natural history. Since 1817, much of the research by this institution's scientists, as well as the work of researchers around the world, has been published in its five serial publications: the Journal of the Academy of Natural Sciences, Monographs, Notulae Naturae, Proceedings of the Academy of Natural Sciences, and Special Publications.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of copies of publications of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia and of records of the Scientific Publications Department. Scientific publications include: Proceedings of the Academy of Natural Sciences; Notulae Naturae; Journal of the Academy of Natural Sciences; Academy News; Frontiers; and selected monographs and special publications. Other Academy publications included in the collection are: annual reports and president's reports; by-laws and articles of incorporation of the Academy; lists of members and correspondents; FYI Newsletters; museum guides and library brochures; membership brochures; children's brochures; and fundraising brochures. Records of the Scientific Publications Department consist of working files from the 1970s and 1980s of Jan Schmitz, Nancy Katz Colman, and other staff members. These files include correspondence, copies of newspaper and magazine articles, press releases and press kits, drafts of articles and reports, invoices for printing and photo reproduction, reference material for various Academy activities and programs, and monthly activity reports for all Academy departments (1983-1990). The collection also includes printing plates for articles published in the ANSP Journal, octavo and quarto; CD-ROMS containing working and final versions of a 2002 special publication on the Lewis and Clark Herbarium (2002); and photos of Academy events and visitors.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: ANS Frontiers Magazine papers (collection 597).
